issue.title: Manual Request Editor submits original request instead of edited values

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hi ZAP Team, 

I thinks I discovered an issue when trying to test for privilege escalation by manipulating a request and swapping an unprivileged session ID into a request that was originally from a application admin.

I found it weird that all my tests worked without exception(it is never that easy :P)

The issue is as the title describes, ZAP does not submit an edited request when you try to tamper with it in the request editor. It actually sends the original request with all the original values.
I was able to reproduce this across multiple restarts(OS and ZAP), reinstalled  ZAP, etc. nothing seems to solve it. I wasn't able to test this on a different computer, so I really hope it is not one of those things that only happens on my computer.

The version I'm using is: 2.7.0
The OS I'm using is OSX 10.13.3 (17D102) on a MacBook Pro.
My Java version is:
java version "1.8.0_91"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_91-b14)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.91-b14, mixed mode)

Steps to reproduce.
1) Select a request on request history and click "Open/Resend with Request Editor"
2) Edit the value of the session cookie to something else
3) Submit request
4) Check newly added(last) record on request history. The value of the cookie submitted is in fact the same as the original request instead of the value you modified on step 2.

Let me know if there is anything I can help with or if you need any additional information.

Cheers, 
R8tor,

issue.title: Warn when unable to save malformed HTTP message

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change models to throw an exception if unable to create the HTTP headers
instead of just logging a warning and continue, to allow to show the
error to the user.
Change Manual Request Editor and Break to warn if the data was not
actually set into the message.
Warn when unable to switch components, views, and HTTP method.

Fix #4235.

issue.title: requester: warn on malformed messages
issue.body:
Catch exception that might be thrown when saving the request panel and
inform the user.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#4235.

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
